command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Imports an ARM Template to a Blueprint.

Imports an ARM Template to a Blueprint. If the Blueprint does not exist, it gets created. Parameters are transformed and added to the Blueprint in the same style as in the GUI in the portal. An artifact is created with the appropriate parameters in both the template and the parameter section.
Parameter types are carried over and securestring variables are automatically created with a Azure Vault reference in the blæueprint.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the blueprint.json file - blueprint is default
The target directory for the blueprint and artifact files
The path to the ARM template to transform
Name of the Artifact and the name of the artifactfile
Name of the Resource Group in the Blueprint
Name of the blueprint.json file - blueprint is default
The target directory for the blueprint and artifact files
The path to the ARM template to transform
Name of the Artifact and the name of the artifactfile
Name of the Resource Group in the Blueprint

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Import-AzureBlueprintArtifact -ARMTemplateJson C:\dev\ARMTemplates\azuredeploy.json -TargetDirectory C:\Dev\NewBlueprint\ -ResourceGroup Network -ArtifactName HUBNet

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates 2 files in the C:\Dev\NewBlueprint\ folder: blueprint.json HUBNet.json

The blueprint.json file will hold the Network resource group and all the parameters needed to deploy the HUBNet.json template. The HUBNet.json template will contain the original ARM template, but only with the stub-parameters and a parameter section referencing the Blueprint parameters.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new BlueprintJsonObject for internal use.
BlueprintJsonObjects are used internally in the module to add, change and remove parts of data.

maml:Description.maml:para: Parameters for the Blueprint
Description for the Blueprint - 'Autogenerated Blueprint' is default. This can be changed after creation
Target scope is set to subscription as default
Name of the Resource Group that should be created
Description for the Blueprint - 'Autogenerated Blueprint' is default. This can be changed after creation
Parameters for the Blueprint
Name of the Resource Group that should be created
Target scope is set to subscription as default

maml:description.maml:para: Set the updated parameters on the artifact. Used internally
Sets the updated parameters on the artifact, both in the template and in the artifact

maml:Description.maml:para: The parameters currently used in the ARM template Parameter value
Name of the resource group
This switch returns a Hash Table containing the old<->new values. Used for matching and renaming
Can be used for updating the parameter displayName style. Default is "ParameterName (TemplateName)" as in the Portal GUI
Can be used for updating the parameter naming style. Default is TemplateName_ParameterName as in the Portal GUI

Name of the resource group
This switch returns a Hash Table containing the old<->new values. Used for matching and renaming
Can be used for updating the parameter displayName style. Default is "ParameterName (TemplateName)" as in the Portal GUI
Can be used for updating the parameter naming style. Default is TemplateName_ParameterName as in the Portal GUI

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updates the current parameters to match the naming style in the Portal GUI and stores them in the $MarkedParameters variable

maml:description.maml:para: Add a folder containing a Azure Blueprint and Azure Blueprint Artifacts as an Azure Blueprint
Add a collection of JSON artifacts to Azure Blueprint. The Name of the folder containing the Blueprint JSON files will be the name of the Blueprint.
All templates with 'kind' attributes become artifacts. Omit the 'kind' attribute on one of the templates - usualy the one declaring the main resource groups - to make it the root Blueprint

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the folder containing the Blueprint and artifacts
Passes the created template to thje pipeline
Name of the folder containing the Blueprint and artifacts
Passes the created template to thje pipeline

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ChildItem C:\Blueprints\AxTest
Directory: C:\Dev\AxBlueprint\AxTest
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a---- 11/3/2018 1:12 PM 1142 Blueprint.json -a---- 11/3/2018 9:51 AM 387 Management-RBAC-Contributor.json -a---- 11/3/2018 9:51 AM 375 Management-RBAC-Owner.json -a---- 11/3/2018 9:58 AM 425 Network-Policy-RestrictNSG.json -a---- 11/3/2018 1:14 PM 384 Network-RBAC-Contributor.json -a---- 11/3/2018 1:14 PM 372 Network-RBAC-Owner.json -a---- 11/3/2018 10:02 AM 1541 Network-Template-VNet.json -a---- 11/3/2018 1:16 PM 407 Subscription-Policy-AllowedLocations.json
PS C:\> Set-AzureBlueprint -BlueprintFolder C:\Blueprints\AxTest

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a Blueprint called AxTest and adds the artifacts accordingly.
